result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] was dismissed by the court.

  • Rodney Dean Dale was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation by Tuesday at 4:00 p.m.
Count 2 merged and dismissed.
Bond is revoked and Defendant remanded into custody.
Credit for 1 day against ultimate sentence.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF: Rodney Dean Dale appeared from jail, pro se. Case called at 1:13. Court reviews file, there is a furlough request by the DE. ADA Hartung responds and willing to withdraw the objection. Court will authorize the furlough. DE parents will pick him up at 7:00pm may 16, he will attend the graduation on May 17 and return home approximately 2:00am May 18, 2015. Conditions of furlough :  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. DE is to remain in the custody of his parents the entire time. DE will need to get a travel permit prior to leaving.
Hearing on May 12, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
E: DOC. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Fox, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski, DF: Rodney Dean Dale appeared. There is an agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty to the AMENDED charge of OWI 4th (passenger < 16 yrs is STRICKEN). DE pleads GUILTY to count 1. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of OWI 4th, as AMENDED. On motion of the State, Crt merges and dismisses Ct 2. Sentencing arguments. Statements made on behalf of def. Atty Kucinski files exhibits C, A, & B.
Crt orders: S/W 2 years Probation with conditions: 
- $1694.00 fine. Apply bond on file. Balance to be paid through probation
- $118.00 blood draw costs.
- Pay all supervision fees. 
- AODA and follow all recommendations
- 27 months license revocation, with credit for administrative suspension 
- 27 month ignition interlock device
- 60 days in St. Croix County Jail. Huber is authorized for work. Credit for good time. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and regular testing
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
Defendant to file furlough paperwork for upcoming graduation. 
Defendant to report to probation by Tuesday at 4:00 pm. 
Bond is revoked and def is remanded to Sheriff. 
Credit for 1 day time served against ultimate sentence.
Plea hearing on May 1, 2015 at 04:15 pm.
